mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Destroyed archway at Waterfront Area, Cavite City, Philipphine Islands

mods:mods.mods:abstract: This image depicts destroyed archway near waterfont area at entrance to Cavite City, Philippine Islands, after the Japanese aerial attack on December 10, 1941.

mods:name.mods:namePart: United States. Navy. Motor Torpedo Boat Squadron 3

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Bomb Damaged Post Exchange

mods:mods.mods:abstract: This image depicts a heavily bomb damaged Post Exchange building at Cavite Navy Yard, Philippine Islands, in the aftermath of the December 10 1941 Japanese aerial attack.

mods:name.mods:namePart: United States. Navy. Motor Torpedo Boat Squadron 3

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Destroyed Entrance to Cavite City

mods:mods.mods:abstract: This image depicts a close up view of destroyed archway with a U.S. Navy Sailor in Dress White Uniform at entrance to Cavite City, Philippine Islands in the aftermath of the Japanese aerial attack on December 10, 1941. A bomb crater can be seen in front of the sailor.

mods:name.mods:namePart: United States. Navy. Motor Torpedo Boat Squadron 3

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Motor Torpedo Boat 41, PT-41, Cavite Navy Yard Dock

mods:mods.mods:abstract: This image depicts PT-41, Flag Ship of Motor Torpedo Squadron 3, with Squadron flag raised immediately after the Japanese aerial attack on December 10, 1941. PT-41 evacuated General Douglas MacArthur from Corregidor to Mindanao on 12 March 1942.

mods:name.mods:namePart: United States. Navy. Motor Torpedo Boat Squadron 3

mods:mods.mods:abstract: This depicts a destroyed Motor Torpedo Squadron 3 Warehouse with a destroyed ambulance at the dock.

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Litter Bearers in Front of Destroyed Motor Torpedo Squadron 3 Warehouse

mods:mods.mods:abstract: This image also depicts litter bearers carrying a wounded person in front of destroyed Motor Torpedo Squadron 3 Warehouse after the Japanese aerial attack on December 10, 1941. A small girl accompanies the wounded person. The litter bearers wear early WWI style helmets and carry M1903 Springfield Rifles.

mods:name.mods:namePart: United States. Navy. Motor Torpedo Boat Squadron 3

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Litter Bearers in Front of Destroyed Motor Torpedo Squadron 3 Warehouse

mods:mods.mods:abstract: This image also depicts litter bearers carrying a wounded person in front of destroyed Motor Torpedo Squadron 3 Warehouse after the Japanese aerial attack on December 10, 1941. An unknown man, possibly a doctor, inspects the wounded person on the litter. The litter bearers wear early WWI style helmets and carry M1903 Springfield Rifles.
